column5: With a pike tournament coming up this weekend, Sparrow Lake hosted by the Barrie Bassmasters.  I thought it would be a good idea to get out and scout after work this afternoon.  Sparrow does not have many big pike and would anticipate 15 pounds to win it for a 3 fish limit.  That being said, in 3.5 hours we caught about a dozen, and left every spot after 2 fish (followers or takers).  Got lots of fish, but none really bigger than 3-4 pounds.  Seeing as it was a tournament pre-fish, I will not reveal much information, but after the weekend, I may update the post. P.S. My girlfriend kicked my ass!!   5 minutes into the day!   Kelli's first of the day   The girl is on fire!   Another nice one   Kelli with yet another   Kelli with another   I got the last one of the day.
Thanks for the multiple SNOT ROCKET REPORT.A great way to warm up before a tournament.  MTP
The more the merrier!  Good luck!
Congrats to both of you on some nice fish.  They may not be big but they're fun to catch. 007
hey smart man! letting her outfish you is a great way to make sure a little somethin somethin comes your way!  cheers!
Lots of good snot rocket fishing there. There are some big ones,but very few and far between out there.  Good luck on the weekend,and TFS.
the camouflage my friend, that's why she out-fished you.  Those snotrockets are wiley beasts, Kelli just blended right into their environment
